meanings.sent1: She infracts the speed limit by driving too fast.
meanings.sent2: He always infracts the school rules by talking loudly in class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel infracts the 'Do Not Feed' sign by stealing birdseed.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior infracts the boundaries of common sense.
meanings.sent5: Infracting the law can lead to serious consequences.

meanings.definition: Breaks or breaches a contract or agreement
meanings.sent1: The company infracts the terms of the partnership agreement.
meanings.sent2: She unknowingly infracts the rental contract by having a pet in the apartment.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful baker infracts the agreement by delivering the wrong order.
meanings.sent4: Breaking the contract infracts the trust between the parties involved.
meanings.sent5: Infracting the agreement can result in legal disputes.

meanings.definition: Causes harm or damage to something
meanings.sent1: The storm infracts the fragile ecosystem of the coral reef.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally infracts the delicate vase by dropping it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy infracts the garden by digging up the flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions infract the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: Infracting the fragile object resulted in irreversible damage.
